chargeHist.descr: Possess Cocaine with intent to deliver (>5-15g)

result.execSummary:
The defendant David L. KOMOROSKY was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess cocaine, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain fulltime employment, schooling or a combination of both.
On count 2 only, the Court orders expungement under Section 973.015 upon successful completion of the sentence.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

No contact with Avelardo Vazquez.

Provide DNA sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David L. KOMOROSKY

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Settlement Conference Summary.
Plea hearing is set for 03-17-16 at 10:00 a.m.
Plea date on March 17, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Request and Response Re: Copies mailed 02-24-2016 KEK
Defendant's Notice of Motion; Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty pleas entered.  Jury calendar.
Settlement conference with District Attorney is set for 03-15-16 at 8:45 a.m.
Minutes.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.    Preliminary hearing is set for 02-10-16 at 2:00 p.m.  
Minutes.
RE:  PTC possess cocaine with intent to deliver, on 01-19-16.

At 9:15 a.m., $100.00 cash bail furnished and the defendant is released from custody.
Notice to Party Furnishing Cash Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of PTC possess cocaine with intent to deliver and felony bail jumping.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 02-01-16 at 2:30 p.m. Bail is set at $100.00 cash with the conditions that he have no contact with Avelardo Vazquez, not to possess any controlled substances and maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs.  Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed. 
Minutes.
